text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM n="7">
  Denen Herren Negotianten, welche das bekannte Wechsel-Buch:
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE xml:lang="fr">La Banque rendue facile aux principales Nations de l’Europe</TITLE>
    <AUTHOR>Gixauidenae</AUTHOR>
  </BIBL>
  haben, zu wissen gethan, daß der Author desselben solches mit einem dritten Supplement vermehren, auch das gantze Werck durch Subscriptionen zum zweyten Mahl drucken lassen wird, wovon das Project bey Herrn Samuel Haag, dem Buchbinder zum gelben Horn am Spahlenberg, zu haben, auch bey ihme zu subscribiren ist.
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":8,"explanation":"1) Wrapped the leading item number in an attribute: changed the bare text "7." to ITEM attribute n="7" for structured identification.
2) Closed and repositioned the AUTHOR element: originally <BIBL><AUTHOR>247. Gixauidenae</AUTHOR>, with extra numeric prefix and BIBL not closed before the rest of the sentence; moved AUTHOR inside BIBL together with TITLE and removed the stray comma that followed AUTHOR.
3) Removed spurious "247." before the author name, interpreting it as an OCR/encoding artifact rather than part of the name.
4) Added closing </BIBL> before the continuation of the sentence, which was missing in the original XML, to avoid mixing bibliographic metadata with running text.
5) Normalized and corrected the French title: from "La Banque vendie facile anae principales Nation de lEurope" to "La Banque rendue facile aux principales Nations de l’Europe" (likely intended historical title), fixing multiple OCR/orthographic issues and adding proper apostrophe in "l’Europe".
6) Added xml:lang="fr" attribute to <TITLE> to indicate the language of the French title explicitly.
7) Corrected several German OCR/encoding issues: replaced "da der Anthor" with "daß der Author"; "dridten" to "dritten"; normalized spelling like "Mahl" for clarity while keeping early-modern flavor; also added missing commas for readability.
8) Added line breaks and indentation to make the XML structure clearer and more readable without changing semantics."}

parsed.fixed_xml:
<ITEM n="7">
  Denen Herren Negotianten, welche das bekannte Wechsel-Buch:
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE xml:lang="fr">La Banque rendue facile aux principales Nations de l’Europe</TITLE>
    <AUTHOR>Gixauidenae</AUTHOR>
  </BIBL>
  haben, zu wissen gethan, daß der Author desselben solches mit einem dritten Supplement vermehren, auch das gantze Werck durch Subscriptionen zum zweyten Mahl drucken lassen wird, wovon das Project bey Herrn Samuel Haag, dem Buchbinder zum gelben Horn am Spahlenberg, zu haben, auch bey ihme zu subscribiren ist.
</ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
1) Wrapped the leading item number in an attribute: changed the bare text "7." to ITEM attribute n="7" for structured identification.
2) Closed and repositioned the AUTHOR element: originally <BIBL><AUTHOR>247. Gixauidenae</AUTHOR>, with extra numeric prefix and BIBL not closed before the rest of the sentence; moved AUTHOR inside BIBL together with TITLE and removed the stray comma that followed AUTHOR.
3) Removed spurious "247." before the author name, interpreting it as an OCR/encoding artifact rather than part of the name.
4) Added closing </BIBL> before the continuation of the sentence, which was missing in the original XML, to avoid mixing bibliographic metadata with running text.
5) Normalized and corrected the French title: from "La Banque vendie facile anae principales Nation de lEurope" to "La Banque rendue facile aux principales Nations de l’Europe" (likely intended historical title), fixing multiple OCR/orthographic issues and adding proper apostrophe in "l’Europe".
6) Added xml:lang="fr" attribute to <TITLE> to indicate the language of the French title explicitly.
7) Corrected several German OCR/encoding issues: replaced "da der Anthor" with "daß der Author"; "dridten" to "dritten"; normalized spelling like "Mahl" for clarity while keeping early-modern flavor; also added missing commas for readability.
8) Added line breaks and indentation to make the XML structure clearer and more readable without changing semantics.
